CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: I ds = ( W / 2L ) × μ × C i ( V gs - V th ) The OFET device using as-cast PCDTBT films without thermal annealing exhibits a hole mobility of 2.2 × 10^-4 cm^2 / V°s with an on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) of 4.44 × 10^3 .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. W - Work function
2. L - Length
3. μ - Electrical conductivity (also known as mobility)
4. C - Capacitance
5. Vg - Gate voltage
6. Vth - Threshold voltage
7. PCDTBT - Polycrystalline cubic diamond thin films (a type of semiconductor material)

Note that some of these entities may be represented by symbols or abbreviations, but they are all material properties or parameters that are relevant to the OFET device being discussed in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PCDTBT (Polycrystalline cubic diamond thin films)

So, the only material name entity in the paragraph is:

1. PCDTBT

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: I ds = ( W / 2L ) × μ × C i ( V gs - V th ) The OFET device using as-cast PCDTBT films without thermal annealing exhibits a hole mobility of 2.2 × 10^-4 cm^2 / V°s with an on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) of 4.44 × 10^3 .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. W (Working) - This is the name of the property being described in the paragraph.
2. L (Length) - This is the unit of measurement for the property, in this case, the length of the device.
3. μ (Mobility) - This is the name of the property being described, which represents the hole mobility of the OFET device.
4. C (Capacitance) - This is the name of the property being described, which represents the capacitance of the device.
5. V (Voltage) - This is the name of the property being described, which represents the voltage across the device.
6. I (Current) - This is the name of the property being described, which represents the current flowing through the device.
7. Vgs (Gate-Source Voltage) - This is the name of the property being described, which represents the voltage across the gate and source terminals of the device.
8. Vth (Threshold Voltage) - This is the name of the property being described, which represents the threshold voltage of the device.

So, the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are: W, L, μ, C, V, I, Vgs, and Vth.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to material properties in the given paragraph:

1. μ (Mobility) - This is the name of the property being described, which represents the hole mobility of the OFET device.
2. C (Capacitance) - This is the name of the property being described, which represents the capacitance of the device.

So, the only two relevant entities in the paragraph are:

1. μ (Mobility)
2. C (Capacitance)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| μ (Mobility) |
| C (Capacitance) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: I ds = ( W / 2L ) × μ × C i ( V gs - V th ) The OFET device using as-cast PCDTBT films without thermal annealing exhibits a hole mobility of 2.2 × 10^-4 cm^2 / V°s with an on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) of 4.44 × 10^3 .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Value" entities:

1. W (Width) - a physical parameter representing the width of the device.
2. L (Length) - a physical parameter representing the length of the device.
3. μ (Mobility) - a physical parameter representing the hole mobility of the device.
4. C (Capacitance) - a physical parameter representing the capacitance of the device.
5. Vgs (Gate-Source Voltage) - a physical parameter representing the voltage between the gate and source terminals of the device.
6. Vth (Threshold Voltage) - a physical parameter representing the threshold voltage of the device.
7. Ion (On-Off Current Ratio) - a physical parameter representing the ratio of the on-state current to the off-state current of the device.

Note that some of these entities are represented by symbols (e.g., μ, C, Vgs, Vth) while others are represented by words (e.g., width, length, on-off current ratio).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given paragraph:

1. μ (Mobility) - a physical parameter representing the hole mobility of the device.
2. Ion (On-Off Current Ratio) - a physical parameter representing the ratio of the on-state current to the off-state current of the device.

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer to the value of material properties. The other entities (W, L, Vgs, Vth) are not directly related to the value of material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities related to material properties in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| μ (Mobility) |
| Ion (On-Off Current Ratio) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
